page.title: 01ON THE FRINGES OF KILSYTH
page.content: Kilsyth is a small town of 10,000 people,about 15 miles N.E. of Glasgow. Our block includes the N.W. quarter of the town-largely {residential}in nature.Most of our block,however, consists of{farmland}stretching up the slopes of the {Campsie Fells. The countryside is very attractive, and is used for walking,bird-watching, and picnics.The hills rise to over 450 metres,and give scenic views over the{ {Kelvin Valley.} Our area has a long {history} ,although much of the evidence has been destroyed.A{stone-age axe}was found near Bogside Farm;there is a medieval"motte"close-by,and the ruins of Kilsyth Castle can still be seen.{ {Antonines Wall,}built by the Romans, passes by to the South of our area.
